column2: Protecting EU’s last remaining primary and old-growth forests
column4: When identifying and implementing the restoration measures to meet the objectives and obligations set out in Articles 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10, Member States shall aim to contribute to the commitment of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030 at Union level.
column6: Protecting primary and old-growth forests while also aiming to plant additional trees can contribute to enhancing forest cover and biodiversity, supporting climate change mitigation, and ensuring sustainable forest management practices.
column7: This connection highlights the dual approach of conserving existing forests and expanding forest cover through reforestation efforts, both of which are critical for achieving biodiversity and climate goals.
